rules.natural: Either the artist has a license for the artwork or the artwork is in the public domain.
Provided that automated screening is enabled on the platform, either the artwork has a virus scan or, if the artist has a license for the artwork, then the artwork is approved for the platform.
Whenever manual screening is required for the artwork, automated screening is bypassed for the artwork.
In the event that manual screening is required for the artwork, it is not the case that automated screening is bypassed for the artwork.
Should the artwork be in the public domain, then it is approved for the platform.
If the artwork is flagged as suspicious, then it has a virus scan.
Either the artwork is flagged as suspicious or a manual review of the artwork is complete.
Whenever a manual review of the artwork is complete, the curator approved the artwork.
If the curator approved the artwork, then it passed the technical check.
Should the curator approve the artwork, then it passed the aesthetic review.
In the case that the artwork passed the technical check, if the artist has a license for the artwork, then the artwork is approved for the platform.
If the artist submitted an appeal, then the appeal was granted to the artist.
Whenever the artist submits an appeal, it is not the case that the appeal is granted to the artist.

If it is not the case that, when the artwork passed the aesthetic review, then if the artist has a license for the artwork, the artwork is approved for the platform, then the artist submitted an appeal.
In the event that automated screening is not enabled on the platform, manual screening is required for the artwork.
